intro: Psychotria erythrocephala, commonly known as the red-headed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers, making it visually distinctive. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded environments. Psychotria erythrocephala is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as psychotrimine.
